```{r}
library(tidyverse)

```

Voter turnout in elections is often influenced by several factors, one of which is social pressure. Using the dataset of registered voters from a 2006 field experiment in Michigan, I seek to estimate the causal effect of receiving a postcard on the probability that a registered voter participates in the 2006 Michigan primary election.
